title: 6 Easy Steps to Manually Update iTunes

steps.title: Open iTunes.
steps.content: Open iTunes . This looks like a multi-colored music note in a circle. In most cases, iTunes will automatically notify you of any updates when you open the application. If you don't see a pop-up, continue to the next step to manually check for an update.

steps.title: Click Help.
steps.content: Click Help . This is in the top toolbar, next to Account .

steps.title: Click Check for Updates.
steps.content: Click Check for Updates . You can find this in the drop-down menu. If iTunes is already updated to the latest version, you'll see a pop-up window with This version of iTunes is the current version . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Download iTunes.
steps.content: Click Download iTunes . This will open the Apple Software Update window.

steps.title: Click Install 1 item.
steps.content: Click Install 1 item . Make sure the box is checked next to iTunes . You may need to provide the administrator's password to approve the download.

steps.title: Click Yes to restart your computer.
steps.content: Click Yes to restart your computer. Once your computer has restarted, the update will be complete. You can also uninstall iTunes and download it again from the Apple website .
